title.narrative: Provision of multisector lifesaving assistance to cyclone-affected people in Nampula and Zambezia provinces

description.narrative:
The main objective of this project is to provide life-saving multi-sectoral assistance – health and WASH – to communities in the Nampula and Zambezia provinces of Mozambique affected by Tropical Cyclone Gombe. The health component will include replenishment of health-related stocks of medical supplies and materials to ensure the resumption of essential maternal, neonatal, infant, and child health and nutrition care. In addition, financial support will be provided for minor repairs of the most affected health facilities, with particular focus on sites offering maternal and child healthcare services. Additional tents, medicines, and medical supplies (including nutrition therapeutic supplies) will be procured and positioned at the district level warehouse to avoid pipeline breaks. The targeted beneficiaries total 60,000 people, including 12,000 women, 48,000 children, and 100 persons with disabilities.
The WASH component will focus on the restoration of water systems, while water trucking is being conducted. Minimum WASH services will be provided in accommodation and resettlement centers, with water trucking, emergency latrine, and distribution of hygiene kits. WASH implementing partners will repair damaged water points and work with communities to rebuild their latrines and maintain basic hygiene practices. The targeted beneficiaries, for this component, total 30,000 people, including 7,485 women, 6,885 men, 15,630 children, and 2,401 persons with disabilities.

owner-org.narrative: UN OCHA Central Emergency Response Fund (CERF)

organisation.narrative: UN Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA)

mailing-address.narrative: United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA), Central Emergency Response Fund (CERF), 2 United Nations Plaza (DC2), East 44th street (13th floor), United Nations, New York, USA

condition.narrative: CERF funding is based on an agreed proposal, including specific planned outcomes and outputs.

description.narrative: Restore and improve access to WASH services for 30,000 persons affected by cyclone Gombe
